definition: variant of 為|为[wei4], because of/for/to
variant of 為|为[wei2]/as (i.e. in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do
as (in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do/by (in the passive voice)

sentences.english: Thought is already is late, exactlly is the earliest time.
sentences.chinese: 觉得为时已晚时，恰恰是最早的时候。

sentences.english: Demeter came, but it was too late.
sentences.chinese: 得墨忒尔恍然大悟，但为时已晚。

sentences.english: And it won't tell you if the company has the right long term strategy. Actually it will tell you all of that but after it is too late to do anything about it.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，它将来会告诉你一切，但那是以为时已晚。

sentences.english: IT IS too late to warn of a civilian slaughter in north-eastern Sri Lanka.
sentences.chinese: 现在才警告世人斯里兰卡东北部的平民屠杀为时已晚。

sentences.english: While she eventually found out that he had been Jason, yet it was too late.
sentences.chinese: 虽然她最后发现他是一个薄情郎，但为时已晚。

sentences.english: Jane ZhaoXing telex o seven and rushed to the malacca but it was too late.
sentences.chinese: 简阿七和肇兴收到电报赶往马六甲，却为时已晚。

sentences.english: But by then, it's too late.
sentences.chinese: 但当它显现出来之时，为时已晚。

sentences.english: I tried to dissuade him, but it was too late.
sentences.chinese: 我试图劝阻他，但为时已晚。

sentences.english: When the cancer finally grows big enough to represent a real threat, it's too late.
sentences.chinese: 当癌肿最后大到真的构成威胁时，一切都为时已晚了。

sentences.english: prior to that type of control is completely lost.
sentences.chinese: 等到完全混乱了再采取行动为时已晚。

definition: unable to turn around a hopeless situation (idiom)/to fail to save the situation
unable to turn around a hopeless situation (idiom)/to fail to save the situation
too late for regrets (idiom); It is useless to repent after the event.
things turn out contrary to the way one wishes (idiom)
too late for regrets (idiom); It is useless to repent after the event.
lit. to mend the pen after sheep are lost (idiom)/fig. to act belatedly/better late than never/to lock the stable door after the horse has bolted
no strategy left to try (idiom); at one's wit's end/at the end of one's tether/powerless
